quest.name: Strange Bedfellows
journal: With the immediate crisis averted, Lucia seeks to gain a clearer understanding of the present situation.
objectives: Survey the designated locations and deal with any enemies that appear.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: We will make no attempt to resist.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Before we proceed, tell me what you know of the Ist Legion and the disposition of their forces.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: They were preparing for war while the refugees in their care were left to go hungry? A reckless, shortsighted plan that risks the welfare of the people they are sworn to protect.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Nevertheless, we cannot compel them to accept our aid. If we were to arrive in force with the intent to do so, we would only incite panic...but perhaps they can be persuaded to follow one of their own.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Go with Jullus back to the station and have him lead the refugees here. Some may be unwilling or unable to leave, but for the time being, I'll take what I can get.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Alphinaud, Alisaie, and the scouts sent to extricate them should already be at the station. I will also have our other comrades in the area lend their support should it be needed.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: ...Understood.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: I will have food and bedding prepared for the refugees. Getting them here safely, however, is my immediate concern...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Tis a comfort to see thee none the worse for thy recent ordeals.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Oh, I did not expect you to arrive so soon. There's been a...development. Perhaps you had best see for yourself.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: What are you doing back here? Where are Jullus and the others!?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Forename...and Jullus.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We arrived just before you did...and too late.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Too late for what? What's happened?

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: It's Lord Quintus... He took his own life.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: After the news about the Xth, he relieved us of our duties. Then, when he was alone, he...

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: No... No, he wouldn't...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Thancred and the others─assisted by the soldiers─have seen to the remains.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: In due course shall the legatus be afforded a proper burial.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: He released us from our duty...

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: He wanted us to be free. Free to choose our own fate.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Without him to guide us, we're... I...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I have just this moment spoken with Lucia.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: We are ready to commence the transfer of the refugees here to Camp Broken Glass, should they be willing to accept our aid.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: Some...would rather die...

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: ...But most of us just want to live. Songs and standards be damned─we just want to live.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We'll need to speak with the refugees. They'll have to decide for themselves if they wish to come with us.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: If any would prefer to stay, we can have supplies brought over for them. It'll be a hard journey for the others, but we'll see they reach our camp safely.

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: After what happened to his family, the Ist was all Jullus had left. Now even that's been taken away from him...

dialogue.name: COLLEAGUESOLDIER
dialogue.text: He's not alone in that, either. There's a comfort in having someone to follow. Someone to lead...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: This is where it happened...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: ...Best not to dwell on it. Not when there's work to be done.

dialogue.name: SABINIANUS
dialogue.text: It was only ever a dream, wasn't it. To think we could reclaim it. Rebuild it all ourselves...

dialogue.name: SABINIANUS
dialogue.text: Before this all began...I sent my wife and daughter away to the provinces...

dialogue.name: SABINIANUS
dialogue.text: If there's a chance I might see them again, I'll take it. So take me. Take me with you...please.

dialogue.name: SABINIANUS
dialogue.text: I can walk, I think. Just give me a few more moments...

dialogue.name: CAESO
dialogue.text: Well...got the aetheryte sorted in the end. All it took was a few adjustments, and now it works as well as it ever did...

dialogue.name: CAESO
dialogue.text: From what I can tell, the one in Laterum is also functioning as normal. That's where you lot are staying, isn't it?

dialogue.name: CAESO
dialogue.text: Now that most of us are packing up and leaving this place, I reckon there'll be more use for me and my skills over at your camp...

dialogue.name: CAESO
dialogue.text: Since the aetheryte's functioning again, why not give it a try? Be a waste if no one did...

dialogue.name: FLAVIUS
dialogue.text: Ah...it's you. The one who treated me with such kindness...

dialogue.name: FLAVIUS
dialogue.text: I heard from the others that you're not from around here... Heh...I thought you were one of us. Not that it makes much difference now.

dialogue.name: FLAVIUS
dialogue.text: Purebloods, migrants, savages... After a while the words start to lose meaning...until all you're left with is anger and fear and hate and I'm...I'm too tired...

dialogue.name: FLAVIUS
dialogue.text: If you and yours have come to offer aid, I'd be glad to accept.

dialogue.name: FLAVIUS
dialogue.text: I don't believe I asked you your name...

dialogue.name: FLAVIUS
dialogue.text: Forename Surname... Thank you. I will remember it... Always.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We have much to discuss.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Our rescue, the attack on Camp Broken Glass...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...What we'd hoped to talk about with Quintus...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But all of that can wait. More urgent matters demand our attention.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Are any of the refugees willing to come to our camp?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Thank the Twelve. Thank the Twelve...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: You and I should go first and secure the route back to Camp Broken Glass.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: With all the creatures and tempered skulking about, I expect we'll have our hands full.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: This should come in handy. Conqueror's Chain, courtesy of our Lominsan friends. I'd save it for the tempered, though.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I'll mark a few points that need surveying on your map. Once you've taken care of the riffraff, we'll meet back at our camp.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I will stay with the refugees and do what I can to protect them.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: While I have no doubt that you and Thancred will do a fine job clearing a path, we must be ever vigilant for threats that may have slipped the net.

dialogue.name: POPMESSAGE
dialogue.text: A tempered soldier bars the way! Subdue him first, then use the Conqueror's Chain.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You see no threats on the path ahead.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Ah, there you are.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: As expected, I ran into a few beasts who went down without much of a fight. The tempered proved somewhat troublesome, but those chains should keep them under control until our allies take them into custody.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: With that taken care of, I'm to gather a few supplies and then return to the station.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: While I see to that, would you mind apprising Lucia of our progress?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: As it happens, I have some rather pertinent information from our recent scouting forays, but I'll save that for later. First things first, and all that.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Welcome back. I hope they haven't been working you too hard...

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. I was informed of Quintus's suicide... It must have come as a great shock to his men.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: What of the refugees? I'm told some were receptive to our proposal, but I would hear your firsthand account.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: That so many did not hesitate to accept proves how desperate their situation has become. We'll do our best to make them feel welcome.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: The troops who participated in the ambush are no exception. They will be afforded the same treatment as any other refugees, perfidy notwithstanding. After all, even if I wanted to make an example of them, there's no one left to learn from it.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: We will tell our allies that these soldiers were acting under the direct orders of their legatus, and that following his suicide, they offered a full and unconditional surrender.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Perhaps Quintus thought that had he lived, he would be tried as a war criminal, and his men punished with him. Perhaps, by taking his own life, he hoped to absolve them of any culpability. Or perhaps, like too many others, he was a true believer to the end.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Who can say. I didn't know the man, or his heart. His reasons, noble or otherwise, died with him, and it falls to us to clean up the mess...

obj.n: And Then a Hero Comes Along
A Light That Never Goes Out
Brick by Brick, Tank by Tank
Mama, She Is in Rubble Deep
Put Your Plasma Where Your Mouth Is
